data.title: Deus Irae by Philip Dick, First Edition
data.meta_description: Deus Irae by ZELAZNY, Roger; DICK, Philip K. and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Mass Market Paperback. Condition: Very Good. McKie, Angus (illustrator). First Paperback Edition. First UK paperback edition. Previously published by Gollancz in hard covers in 1976. Slight chipping at the top and bottom of the spine. Reading crease down the left side of the front cover next to the spine and a small surface mark to the top left corner of the rear cover but otherwise only light edge wear to covers. Page edges browned with some spotting to the fore edges. Pages browned around the edges but otherwise unmarked. Cover art by Angus McKie. First printing.

Softcover. Cover Illustration by Susan Newman (illustrator). 1st Edition. "A dangerous journey across a devasted landscape in search of the great god of wrath." This novel charts the aftermath of World War Three and the rise of a new religion gathered around an enigmatic "Deus Irae", and the journey of a legless and armless protagonist and his Christian sidekick to discover the truth behind the dogma. A collaborative first for Dick and Zelazny and a must read for the fans of both writers. Well conceived; witty, poetic, and profound. This copy does not appear to have been read, it is in like new condition. Like new condition, slight scuff marks on the outside covers. The spine is near perfect with no creases on either cover, which indicates it was probably never read.

Paperback. Condition: Fine. First Edition Thus; Second Printing. This is the second printing of the "First Vintage Books Edition." Not an ex-library copy. No remainder marks. No names or marks in the text. Most books shipped within 24 hours. All books mailed with Delivery Confirmation in a heavy cardboard box. Unread. Fine condition. Selling Used and Rare books on line since April 1998 and from our bookstore in the heart of the Bluegrass since 1984. ; 8vo.; 182 pages.

Original Cloth. Condition: Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. Cayea, John (illustrator). 1st Edition. Black boards have edge wear, surface creasing and quite heavy bumping to the corners, particularly the top right corner of the front panel which has a crease across it. Top and bottom of the spine have some rubbing. Page edges are browned with a little spotting. Endpapers are slightly browned and there is a small blue smudge to the top corner of the half title page. Pages are otherwise clean and unmarked. Jacket has one inch closed tears on either side at the bottom of the spine and another half inch closed tear at the top of the spine next to the rear panel. Jacket has some edge rubbing, fading and discolouration to the spine and browning to the rear panel. Jacket by John Cayea. First printing.

Stated First Edition, 13.5 x 21.5 cm black boards with orange stamped titles to the spine. Rough cut fore edge [vi] 182[2]pp with unclipped dust jacket priced at $5.95. Clean boards with some shelf wear and pushing to the spine tips and corners. Internally clean, without name, inscription or bookplate and just a tiny corner crease to the front free endpaper and a little spotting to the edge of the text block. The dust jacket is complete and the spine unfaded. The corners and spine tips have some rubbing with a little surface abrasion and associated creasing and there is a 1.5 cm closed tear at the foot of the spine. An interesting work based on a dystopian story of Philip K. Dick's and later finished by Roger Zelazny. Rainford & Parris Books welcomes enquiries, so please do not hesitate to ask if you require further images or have any questions. All books are packaged with great care.

Garden City, Doubleday, 1976, first edition, dust jacket. Hardcover. A first-time collaboration by two giants of the science fiction genre, jacket illustrated by John Cayea, this copy Signed by Zelazny, this is Nit's copy. Bottom edge with the appearance of what might be a very light remainder spray, else fine.
